Merge branch 'truncated-post-fix' into 1.x
- Combined zuul-netflix module into zuul-core. This is a precursor to changing the module structure in preparation for the zuul1-zuul2 bridge layout.
- Started creating new module structure that will support the new 2.x filter interfaces for both tomcat and netty servers.
- Further refactoring to decouple zuul-core from the servlet api. More to come still.

Copied the initial new filter and context model interfaces to this branch (from my abandoned fork of zuul2).
- Still have a lot more to fix and add.
- Further refactoring to use the new filter and context interfaces. Still not complete.
- And further refactoring to use the new filter and context interfaces.
- Junked the zuul-simple-webapp. Only going to focus on supporting the zuul-netflix-webapp for zuul2.
- Finished fixing all the unit-tests afer refactoring.

- Refactored and fixed the groovy filter unit-tests.
- Removed remaining usages of RequestContext and javax.servlet classes.

More fixes for new interfaces.
And fixed the incorrect package naming for the filters.
Fixing a unit-test that fails in the jenkins build. Seems like java.net.URLEncoder encode spaces as '+' on my java8 on mac, but as '%25' on Java7 on linux...
Another fix to unit-test working differently on the jenkins build. The ordering of url parameters is not determinate, so need to avoid testing order of them.
Refactoring the zuul servlet code to use the same Observable-based FilterProcessor impl as that used for netty.

Got servlet/webapp zuul working using the Observable-based FilterProcessor now.
* Using DI for more of the initializtion now.
Getting the zuul-netty-sample working with latest interfaces. Not quite there yet.
- Got zuul-netty-sample app working - but still temporarily using Ribbon instead of rxnetty client.
- Moved some more of the rxnetty-based proxying code from edgezuul-v2. Still a work-in-progress.

Got the zuul-netty-sample app working now.
* Using a basic non-eureka/ribbon LoadBalancer impl.
* An example Routing filter that either proxies to api-global.netflix.com, www.yahoo.com, or executes a static response.
Added and got working an example pre filter that does async IO.
Initial start on porting zuul-netflix-webapp to use the Origin/OriginManager interfaces.
Got zuul-netflix-webapp working with the newer RibbonOriginManager classes.
Various fixes.
only parses params from body for POSTS with form bodies

Merge pull request #122 from mhawthorne/1.x

Only parse params from body for POSTS with form bodies

Further changes to the Filter and Context interfaces.
Merged the separate AsyncFilter and SyncFilter interfaces back into ZuulFilter, as was not working well.

Still have to migrate a lot of the filters across to latest interfaces. WIP.
Mostly finished updating the zuul-netflix-webapp filters to the latest filter interfaces. Still have all the zuul-netty-sample filters to do as well though yet.
Bugfix for POST requests with a body, but no Content-Type header.

Updating more of the filters to new interface.
Changed name of the HttpResponseMessage.getHttpRequest() method to getRequest().
All unit-tests back to green.
Fixed how error filters were being applied.
More fixes for how the error filters are run.
Ensuring that the message passed along from a filter failure does not cause ClassCastException when received by filter in next phase.
Refactored the ZuulNFRequest filter implementations into a common superclass in zuul-core (NfProxyEndpoint).
More work on getting some basic integration test automation in place.
Getting a basic smoke-test working from gradle for zuul-netty-sample.
Getting both sets of integration tests for zuul-netty-sample and zuul-netflix-webapp to have separate properties.
Yet more faffing to get integration tests working with both the jetty and netty servers.
Only run the ExampleIOPreFilter for subset of urls.

Changed the ZuulMessage.body to be an Observable<ByteBuf> again.
- Added an in + out filter to buffer request and response bodies for users that want to avoid having to deal with Observable bodies.
Got streaming of response inputstreams using Observable<ByteBuf> in zuul-servlet.
Stop blocking on request body InputStream in RibbonOrigin. Still need to stop buffering the request body, like we do with response body now for servlets.
Fixing some unit-tests.
Pulled out some Http-specific base classes for filters. Just to make the majority of filters a bit less boilerplate.

Moved the code for buffering message bodies into ZuulMessage.
Not fully finished refactoring the GZip filters to use Observable.
Fixed remaining problems with Gzip filters after having switched to using ZuulMessage.getBodyStream().
Made gradle integationTest not run as part of normal build. Needs to be explicitly run.
Fix for another problem in GZip filter tests.
Added usage of nebula.dependency-lock. And generated a global lock file.

Removed some duplication from gradle files.
Un-hardcoded some dependency versions.
Added boilerplate for a new zuul-jetty module.
Just initial copy of a sample jetty server. No zuul integration yet.
Added a copy of the HTTP2Test class from jetty, and modified to add a test of push promises using the jetty-http2 interfaces directly.

Merge branch '1.x' into zuul2-bridge

Conflicts:
	zuul-core/src/main/java/com/netflix/zuul/http/HttpServletRequestWrapper.java

- Changed case of the name of ZuulBootstrap class, to fix difference in case between file and class.
- RibbonOrigin test fix.
- Added rxnetty-spectator dependency back in.
- Re-generated dependency lock file.

- Renamed the zuul-servlet-api module to zuul-servletapi.
- Renamed the zuul-netflix-webapp module to zuul-servletapi-sample.
Started getting ASM exceptions on startup again, so added the hack for asm versions back in just for zuul-netty-sample.

Merge pull request #125 from Netflix/zuul2-bridge

Zuul2 bridge
Added license header to all files missing it.
Moved some of the RequestCompleteHandler and RequestMetricsPublisher implementations around a bit.

Refactored the SessionContext class:
- Merged the separate Attributes class into SessionContext. As it wasn't really giving any extra value.
- Removed Helpers. Just store them in SessionContext instead now.
Had forgotten to update the Routing filters to use the new SessionContext.getEndpoint() method.
Moved some reusable methods into ProxyUtils class.
Added a port attribute to HttpRequestMessage.
Started storing a copy of the original request info before filters are applied. So can use that in metrics and access log.
Enable servlet attributes set in ServletFilters to be passed to Zuul filters.
Make FilterUsageNotifier injected.
Fixed unit-test.

Fixed some problems with error-handling.
- Removed statusCode from ZuulException.
- Changed order of args to ZuulException constructors so it's the same as normal Exceptions.
- Apply Error endpoints in FilterProcessor more consistently - ie after each phase.
Created a new Timings class that encapsulates the per-request Timing instances in SessionContext.
Added partial impls of timings of request/response body read/writes.
Changed Timing class to be in nanoseconds instead of millis, like edgezuul.
Added a HttpSyncEndpoint base class to remove some boilerplate from static filters.
Added HttpRequestMessage.serverName.
Adding config to tell the jenkins build to use java8.

Added statusCode back to ZuulException defaulting to 500.
Renamed SessionContext.getThrowable() to getError().
Fixed a couple of incorrect usages of isAssignableFrom.

Changed BaseFilter.filterName() to return fully-qualified class name. As sometimes have same class name in different packages.
Formalised the "error-endpoint" attribute on SessionContext.
Moved the sample filters into new directory. So that can remove "filters" from the package names for them, as now using FQN.
Fixing unit-test.
Added a zuul-specific Cookies class.
Added methods to HttpRequestMessage for reconstructing the original request URI.
Added some helper methods for set-cookie handling to HttpResponseMessage.
Added some helper methods to ZuulMessage for setting body as text.
Added Headers.setIfAbsent() method.
Added a new FilterPriority enum that filters can be assigned. This is to be used to flag lower priority filters that can be skipped in situations like zuul throttling due to high load.
Added FilterPriority as 1st class attribute to SessionContext.
Made FilterProcessor only apply each filter if that filter's priority is equals to or greater than the priroity set for the context.
Fixed unit-test.
Added ability to specify classNames to use for filters ("zuul.filters.classes"), as well as the directories of groovy files.
Added a SessionContext.getString() convenience method.

Changed interface of SessionContextFactory.create() to return just ZuulMessage instead of Observable<ZuulMessage>. Because we were always just wrapping the return value in Observable.just() anyway, and found a need for caller to have direct access to the message.
Improved the error handling in ZuulServlet a bit. And added start/stop of request timer.
Added ZuulMessage.setHeaders().
Added Headers.size() method.
Changed HttpRequestMessage.getInfoForLoggin() to use reconstructURI() instead of just pathAndQuery and Host.
Added OriginManager.createOrigin() with rxnetty and ribbon impls.
Removed unused dependency on powermock.
Changed the key name of EventProperties in SessionContext back to what is was before, to keep backward compat with existing filters using it.
Adding convenience method Cookies.getFirstValue().
Added another Headers.contains() convenience method.
Force excluding newer javax.servlet-api (3.+) dependency to stop it being included transitively as well as 2.5.

Switched all the test dependencies to use 'provided'.
Setting 'transitive=false' for the servlet-api dependency to try to workaround some oddness with transitive dependencies of servlet-api 3.0.1 being excluded from downstream project.
Back-out of using 'provided' for test dependencies.
Another attempt at fixing the problem with servlet-api:3.0.1 being included and its dependencies then excluded.
Removing all the servlet-api hacks as not helping.
Don't block startup if there's an error compiling a groovy filter.
Fix bug in handling port specified in a Host header.
Bugfix in FilterProcessor when casting msg to either HttpRequest or HttpResponse.
Storing original response info like was already doing for request.
Added a ZuulMessage.hasBody() method.
Commenting out some tests for the not-yet-used jetty code.
Fixing incorrect placing of the error-handling code for SocketTimeout when reading the servlet request inputstream.
More improvements to handling of SocketTimout on reading servlet request body. Now flags to not proxy, and adds a specific error cause, and 400 status code.
Added updating of the Content-Length header in Gzip filters.
Fixed ZuulMessage.clone() that was erroring if body was null.
Added HttpQueryParams.toString().
Changed the error handling of sockettimeout when reading request body, to use Observable.onErrorReturn instead of doOnError, so that this is the only error handler notified.
Added HttpQueryParams.clear().
Exclude 'keep-alive' as a proxied response header.

Combined the HttpRequestInfo class into the HttpRequestMessage class hierarchy.
Created separate interfaces and implementations for HttpRequestMessage and HttpResponseMessage.

Renamed the OriginalRequestInfo and OriginalResponseInfo methods to InboundRequest and InboundResponse.
Refactored HttpResponseInfo to be an interface like had done for HttpRequestInfo. And changed the class hierarchy to match Request too.

Replaced response.getRequest() method with getInboundRequest() and getOutboundRequest(). The first being the immutable HttpRequestInfo of originallly received request, and the 2nd being the mutable HttpRequestMessage.
Made the copies of Headers and HttpQueryParams objects held by the immutable copies of HttpResponseInfo and HttpRequestInfo be backed by immutable copies of the underlying multimaps.
Refactored the message-related classes out into new packages.
Moved parseCookies() up from HttpRequestMessage to HttpRequestInfo.
Don't allow null values into Headers. If attempted, assume means to remove any existing header of that name.

Added missing debug logging of response bodies to NfProxyEndpoint.
Bugfix in ZuulHostRequest.
Noticed that the gradle build was not running the groovy unit-tests. So added them.
Fixes and improvements to the Debug class and it's usage.
Added a new UUID attribute to SessionContext, and started writing it out with each debug statement so can tie together the logs more easily.
Fixed a bug in the Observable handling around debug logging of message bodies.
Added contains method to HttpQueryParams.
Added HttpQueryParams.removeAll() method.
Added a variation on HttpResponseMessage.addSetCookie().
Bugfix for ServletSessionContextFactory.write(). Was using response.setHeader() instead of addHeader().
Added some tests for Headers class.

Changed the Headers impl to stop lower-casing the header names (but still compare case insensitively).
- Added Header and HeaderName classes to encapsulate the logic.
- Changed Headers.entries() method to return Collection<Header>.
Copy the X509 cert from ServletRequest attributes to the SessionContext.
Bugfix in FilterProcessor for ClassCastException after sending error response.
Merge branch '2.x' of github.com:Netflix/zuul into 2.x
Bugfix in RibbonOrigin for responses with no body.
Fix for HttpRequestMessageImpl.parseCookies() where it was failing to parse cookies with whitespace in value. So switched to Lax parsing option.

Added explicit dependecy on netty-code-http for zuul-core.
Removed unused dependency on turbine - which in turn was dependent on an older netty version.

Regenerated the global dependencies lock.
Upped version of jetty to 9.3.1 for zuul-jetty-sample.

Consolidated the ZuulServlet and ZuulRequestHandler classes into single ZuulHttpProcessor.
Introduced a SessionCleaner interface which is used to cleanup and release resources related to outbound origin requests at the end of processing.
Bugfix - missed assigning the new sessionCleaner in constructor of ZuulHttpProcessor.
Handle response.getInboundRequest() being null in getInfoForLogging().

Some perf optimization around header names, to reduce the cost of case-insensitive String comparison.
- Added variants of all the methods on Headers class that allow using HeaderName instead of String.
- Created a cache of HeaderNameS, already populated with some common http header names.

Need to start changing filters to use HeaderName cache instead of StringS.
Increase the initial capacity of the SessionContext map, to reduce resize perf cost.
Change Headers class to use the HttpHeaderNames cache rather than instanciating HeaderName instances directly.
Made HeaderName class configurably intern the name StringS, and then do use == for equals.
Added a warn log statement in HttpResponseMessageImpl if constructed with a request object that does not have a stored inboundRequest.
Made the SessionContext initialSize configurable.
Added a few more common http header constants.
Changed Headers.keySet() to return a Set<HeaderName> instead of Set<String>.
Added some more common http header names to the cache.
Added CORS headers to cache.
Moved filterPriority attribute of SessionContext to be a full member rather than an entry in the Map, as it's shown to be a perf hotspot.
Changed HttpRequestMessageImp.parseCookies() to cache on first usage. And added a reParseCookies() method to allow forcibly replacing the cached cookies.
Some more perf optimizations to HttpRequestMessageImpl.
Added some more common headers to HttpHeaderNames.
Changed the BaseFilter default priority to HIGH instead of NORMAL. As thats a more intuitive default.
Removed some unnecessary Observable.single() calls.

Changed the FilterPriority Enum to be just an int. So easier to extend available values without having to make code changes to zuul-core.
Added a new SessionContext.stopFilterProcessing() flag that can be set by filters that want to reject a request and not run any subsequent filters (mostly for throttling and DOS protection purposes).

Gave in and finally added a StaticResponse attribute to SessionContext, so inbound filters can generate a response. FilterProcessor will then use this staticResponse instead of running any endpoint filter, if it is set.
If response body is already buffered as a byte array, then just flush that directly to the servlet outputstream.
Bugfix for FilterProcessor.recordFilterCompletion(). It was only running after ALL filters had finished processing. Changed to run after EACH filter has ran.
Bugfix for FilterProcessor constructor - was setting default usageNotifier if was not null, rather than was null!
Found had a stray subcribe() in ServletSessionContextFactory. Removed it, and can now remove the isBodyBuffered conditional as well.
Bugfix on Timing class. When switched to using nanoseconds, I missed one of the places I needed to change.
Change BasicRequestMetricsPublisher to report in millis instead of nanos.

Changed HttpRequestMessage.reconstructURI() to manually reconstruct the URI just using string concatenation, instead of using java.net.URI. Because the URI class was failing for some illegal characters in Host headers that we receive.
Merge branch '2.x' of github.com:Netflix/zuul into 2.x
Stop stripping out the Server header from response from origins. Should overwrite this in a zuul filter if we don't want to use the Server header from origin, rather than removing it by default.
Added a configurable mechism to strip out 'bad' text from inbound request cookie headers.
Bugfix for header name case sensitivity in CookieCleaner.
Changed tack with the CookieCleaner, and switched to only clean the cookie header when parsing it. Therefore then does not modify the request header that will be proxied onwards.

Revert "Removed some unnecessary Observable.single() calls."

This reverts commit 0674ed699b5d71a653fa3f802e79307510458915.
Added a HttpResponseMessage.removeExistingSetCookie() method.
Made the handling of SocketTimeoutException when reading request body be configurable. Either just log and continue with an empty body, or respond with a 400 status error to client.
Fix to make HttpRequestMessageImpl.getInfoForLogging() log the IP from X-Forwarded-For header if present.

Fix bug in Snapshot adapter.

The `scan` operator version used did not use the initial value factory. This made all subscribers to the same host stream sharing the same state instance.
Since, RxNetty clones the client leading to multiple subscriptions, the state instance was mutated by multiple threads.

This fix now uses a factory for initial state and hence eliminating the state instance sharing.

runtime tunable concurrency for async filters

A slow running async filter can cause high number of concurrent requests to be piled up on frontend. This PR introduces FP controlled concurrency limit that can be tuned for individual filters + single FP to disable filter concurrency limits altogether if we find a bug/leak in the implementation.

Changes:

* Fix generics on some call sites.   This is a breaking change, but needed for type safety.
* Move the default values for a few dynamic properties to the config key.   This avoids an NPE when unboxing the values in BaseZuulChannelInitializer.
    * Note that `connCloseDelay`  Does **not** have a default in the initializer, and picks the default of 0 in `ConnectionCloseChannelAttributes`.  This is a behavior change, but I think it's okay.

zuul-core: fix SSL Bug

In newer versions of Netty, failure to write the ServerHello message result in a SslCompletionEvent and the channel closed. This can happen if the client sends a ClientHello, and then quickly closes the connection.

This change lowers the severity of the message being logged, and adds a test proving the connection cleans up. This test fails on older versions of netty.

* core: Make Server easier to use

* Server now attempts to use SocketAddress instead of port number.  This
will make it easie rin the future to adapt it to using other kinds of
addresses, like LocalAddress in tests.
* Automatically tries to select between Epoll, Kqueue and Nio, based on

and only are useful incase something is going wrong.

zuul-core:  Make BaseServerStartup prefer using socket addresses (#648)

This is an incremental change to allow existing code to slowly move over to socket addresses rather than ports.   Old clients can still override existing methods (but with a deprecation warning), while new clients can override the socket address methods.

zuul-core: Add sockaddr overloads for server startup logging (#649)

* Lowered severity from warn to info
* Made the calls final since I don't think they need to be overridden
* Made generics more relaxed since logger doesn't actually use the values.
* Unchained `logPortConfigured(int)` from `logPortConfigured(int, ServerSslConfig)`, since the overload of the SSL log should not affect the other.

In theory these functions could be static, but I think that would be API limiting if in the future they turned out to depend  on the BaseServerStarter instance.

zuul-core: make BaseZuulChannelInitializer prefer a string over port

Observation: the port number is only ever used to do metric recording, and not for anything networking related. This change overloads the BaseZuulChannelInitializer constructor to prefer a "metric suffix" instead of the port, and deprecates the field.

zuul-core: make direct memory gauge work on jdk 11

Motivation:

Netty on JDK11 doesn't have all the access to the VM internals, so some fields are Null.

Modification:

* Only lookup Netty class once at class init time, and check the fields to access there.   
* If Reserved memory is null, return a default of -1, which is what netty normally returns
* Make more stuff immutable, to ensure the "singleton" property of the class.

Result:

Less spammy logs when running with JDK 11.  Tested Manually.


Note: 

I don't know why these fields are reflectively accessed.  There are actual getters in the PlatformDependent class that could do this.

zuul-core Add Cause of SSL Handshake Error from Origin

When SSL handler reads the message that the handshake failed (for example, because peer certificates are not verified), it populates the through handlers and eventually the failure message goes away. When ProxyEndpoint later tries to talk to origin it usually gets the error of SSLEngine Closed already, which does not display the actual reason why it was closed. This change catches the detailed failure cause and adds it to proxy attempt so client can know what went wrong:

"error":"General OpenSslEngine problem","cause":"java.security.cert.CertificateException: Certificate application name (applicationname) does not match expected name: expectedname","exceptionType":"SSLHandshakeException"
zuul-core: rethrow bind exceptions with more detail

zuul-core: wire socket address from ClientChannelManager down to ClientConnectFactory

This is needed to ensure IPv6 support, and additionally to pass in LocalAddresses for testing in the future.

This avoids passing a string host around, and forces name resolution to happen earlier in the connection. The address to connect to is no longer owned by the Server object, and instead part of the connection pool. The Server object now functions as a way to logically reference a backend.

Additionally, several arguments are no longer used and have been removed, like the path, method, and attempt number in multiple places.

Lastly, blocking DNS reads are still possible, but this change is complicated as it is. I will make this async in a future PR.

zuul-core: refactor Filter loading into mutable and immutable parts


This step is needed to support the construction of static filter registries.  While
dynamic loading will still be supported, Zuul will be moving towards a fixed filter
set model.   This lowers load on live running servers, avoids a dependency on doing
disk reads.   Wide deploying code to live running servers is a risky endeavor, and
Zuul did not develop the necessary safeguards to support this.

After this change, FilterFileManager will be optional, as its sole purpose is to
populate the loader/registry.

all: Stop exposing deps as compile time

* Remove reference to ZuulEndPointRunner.   For some reason, the groovy compiler really wants to link all the classes from there, which includes the base class BaseZuulFilterRunner.
The problem is that a private inner class there uses PerfMark on the ABI which is not present on the groovy compilation classpath.   When groovy tries to compile, it looks for all deps and
fails.

Instead, link to the Proxy endpoint directly to avoid the groovy wart.

zuul-processor: Make a Configuration based processor, and stop producing generated Java files. (#791)

While Gradle worked fine with the existing code, IntelliJ does not.  IntelliJ's
incremental compilation does not include the full classpath, making most of the
files in the Filter class not available.  The generated file thus changes frequently
and prevents running from the IDE.   JetBrains considers this a feature, and will
not change it.

Work around this by generating a list of classes, which is appended, rather than
created from scratch each compilation.  This allows incremental compilation in
IntelliJ to keep running at the cost of potentially having stale filters listed.

zuul-core: replace VIP, origin name, and clientName with a composite object.

The top level idea here is to make the VIP, Origin Name, NIWS Client name, and app name a single struct, which is passed around throughout or pooling code.  Additionally, we need to get away from verbiage and idioms that come from dependencies  such as NIWS, Eureka, and Ribbon.        

High level changes:

* Replace String forms of origin name, client name, and vip with a composite OriginName class.   This class is the primary key of an origin.  
* VIP is renamed to Target.  A Target is something to be used for looking up servers to connect to.
* the VIP Prefix, origin name, and client name are now renamed to niwsClientName.   It is used to define IClientConfig values, as well as for use in Fast properties.
* The niwsClientName is also normalized into a metric ID, usable for Atlas metrics.
* useFullVip (and variants) have been un-wired through out code, and only have an effect when building the OriginName.

zuul-core: always cache full bodies, regardless of SSL

In the scope of Retrying POST bodies in response to 503's Zuul keeps a copy of the body to send again in certain circumstances.   Normally, if the body has not been sent to the origin, and Zuul has not sent anything to the client, Zuul will compromise the HTTP spec and consider POSTs retryable.   (Too many things depend on this wrong behavior; it would risky to change.)  In the current code, Netty's SSL handler will mutate the body when sending it, so the ProxyEndpoint will keep a pristine copy of the body assuming the full body is present.  In the case SSL was not requested, Zuul depends on Netty not clearing the buffers as it sends, and thus doesn't keep the copy around.

Internally at Netflix, we want to automatically upgrade to SSL if possible, but that is only after the ProxyEndpoint code has decided to cache or not.   An Origin may not explicit ask for SSL, but eventually use it, so it is too late to set the NIWS `IsSecure` bit and cache the body.   (Requesting SSL is per Origin, using SSL is per Server).

To ensure that 503's are retryable, and that we don't depend on Netty's HTTP subtleties, this change unconditionally caches the body, and pessimistically assumes that the body could be mutated.  This allows for auto SSL upgrades later down the call chain as well.

Sorry, no tests.   This code definitely warrants a test, but it is ridiculously difficult to add one.   I'm taking out a loan on our tech debt, which I hope to one day pay back.

zuul-core: Selectively enable body caching on retries

This change modifies the proxy logic to cache request bodies only if there have recently
been throttling events.  This means that if we get back a 503, we more agressively cache
request bodies to be able to retry the request.  Previously, Zuul would cache the body
if the origin was secure, or manually request to cache.  This found to be expensive, since
it results in caching all the time, even if the origin is healthy.

This change makes Zuul look to see if there have been any failures in the past 5 minutes.
If there have, Zuul will cache the body for retry, under the expectation the origin will
recover.  This means the very first request that fails due to throttling cannot be retried,
but subsequent failures can.  After enough time has past from the last throttle, Zuul will
stop caching again.   Zuul can be configured to unconditionally cache by setting this value
to -1.

Ensure SessionContext isn't modified when iterating over it (#978)

When routing debugging is enabled, Zuul will record changes in the
session context after each filter is run.  If the context already has a
"routingDebug" property on it, all will be fine.  If not, the comparison
code will (as a side effect) add that property.  However, it's added
while there is an active iterator over the context.  Once the code tries
to fetch the next element from the iterator, a
ConcurrentModificationException is thrown.
